Articles.Content:
do the force flags still work, and are worthwhile for  1.1?

ie these ones?

-force-opengl
-force-directx11
-force-d3d11
I'll take that as a yes for works. Are they worth while when it comes to memory usage?
Yes they work I have to use OpenGL or DirectX 11 to get the game to launch it won't seem to work with DirectX 9.

To my knowledge, on Windows thy usable flags are:

- (none) = d3d9

-force-d3d11 = d3d11, in theory should give better performance than dx9

-force-opengl = old opengl2.x renderer, deprecated

-force-glcore = new opengl 4.x renderer, can potentially surpass d3d11 performance wise and in features, however unity developers report various problems...

 

Interesting would be to benchmark performance and visual quality on different sets of hardware (Intel, AMD, nvidia), to see what gives the best results...

 

 

Edited April 23, 2016 by TheDog
